meanings.definition: To participate or become involved in
meanings.sent1: I will engage in the school play next week.
meanings.sent2: She likes to engage in group activities during recess.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to engage in the game of hide and seek.
meanings.sent4: His mind started to engage in solving the puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The children engage in building sandcastles at the beach.

meanings.definition: To attract or hold the attention of
meanings.sent1: The colorful illustrations in the book engage young readers.
meanings.sent2: The magician's tricks never fail to engage the audience.
meanings.sent3: The movie engaged the viewers with its unexpected plot twists.
meanings.sent4: The new video game can engage players for hours.
meanings.sent5: The catchy tune of the song engages listeners instantly.

meanings.definition: To enter into battle or combat
meanings.sent1: The soldiers will engage the enemy at dawn.
meanings.sent2: The knights prepared to engage in a fierce jousting match.
meanings.sent3: The superheroes engaged in an epic battle to save the city.
meanings.sent4: The rival gangs decided to engage in a turf war.
meanings.sent5: The samurai warriors engaged in a duel of honor.

meanings.definition: To arrange to employ or hire someone
meanings.sent1: The company will engage a new marketing manager next month.
meanings.sent2: She decided to engage a personal trainer to help with her fitness goals.
meanings.sent3: The restaurant will engage additional staff for the busy season.
meanings.sent4: The school board plans to engage a new principal for the upcoming academic year.
meanings.sent5: The business owner needs to engage skilled workers for the project.
